awd_titl_txt: Ontological Foundations for Experimental Science Knowledge  Bases
awd_abstract_narration: The research aims at developing an integrated set of ontological  conventions that addresses the needs of experimental sciences.  In the researchersO earlier work in developing knowledge models  for experimental biology, it was discovered that  there were  several important areas where the knowledge to be represented  poses fundamental challenges to standard ontological frameworks.  For example: 1) the traditional part-of hierarchy is ill-suited  to model the complex substances and mixtures described in  scientific experiments; 2) the primacy of categorization in  knowledge representation, which fundamentally defines entities in  terms of category membership, is at odds with the need to  represent events (such as biochemical reactions) that convert one  substance into another.  The proposed research will improve the  likelihood that ongoing artificial intelligence in knowledge  sharing technology will be of benefit to researchers in  experimental sciences.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
